name: Wickaninnish Inn and The Pointe Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a stay at the Wickaninnish and while the view and the location was amazing everything else just didnt meet the standards they set with their high prices. When I checked out their website I was sure this was going to be a really nice resort with all the great things going for it. Upon arrival we realized it wasn't really that. The staff is very average, the rooms as well. If you are paying an average of $500 per night you really should be getting better than average. The food in the lounge is horrific, don't order the paninis, the worst food i ever had for sure. The restaurant has an amazing view, however the food is nothing to write home about. They have an interesting menu and the chef is a little too creative i think which makes the food interesting as well, no really in a good way always.
reviews.title: Not what it tries to be on the website

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't mean to be so negative about this place, but I had my execptations set high and was just really disappointed.
reviews.title: Disappointing. Did not meet expectations.

reviews.text: Our suite was in the Beach building - very disappointing. The view was disappointing.
reviews.title: Painfully Amazing! Great hospitality, food, natural views.

likes.liked: — The views, location, food, service, town, babysitting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is very well fitted, the suite was furnished very nicely and had all the usual amenities. The TV is in the lounge, not the bedroom and is at floor level - quite odd. The hotel does not have air conditioning and it was impossible to get a comfortable temperature for sleeping - either way too hot with the sliding door closed or very cold in the night with the door open.
reviews.title: Expensive, but exceptional!

likes.liked: — The little details and surprises (yellow rain slickers, for example).
likes.disliked: — My entree at the Pointe was average given the price point.

reviews.text: The restaurant is mediocre. The decor is more like a canteen than a fine dining restaurant although the view makes up for it. The food is hit and miss... chewy tenderloin, overly-ambitious desserts, but pretty good service.
reviews.title: Lackluster customer service

reviews.text: We stayed here with three children, and echo all the positive reviews. Great staff, lovely location, wonderful rooms. Only two negatives: lack of a casual dining option; the Pointe Restaurant is a bit much with kids every night, and we found the food a bit too fussy and weren't always happy with what we had.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, we'll be back, and we really do applaud the staff who were unfailingly polite , helpful and just wonderful.
reviews.title: We love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third trip to the Wick. I do not care what anyone says about this place, we love it. Yes it is expensive, but what do people expect to pay for a location like that! There are other oceanfront hotels in Tofino, but none compare to the Wick. Our room was in the original building with a fantastic view of the beach and the ocean, the balcony completely private and though by no means large was big enough to sit out and relax with an eagle tree right in front of us. The bathroom was large with a seperate shower, large tub overlooking the ocean and Aveda toileteries. A note about the bed, it is one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in. You can leave the door to the balcony open all night listening to the sound of the ocean as you fall asleep. it does not get much better than that. The staff were excellent, it was my husbands birthday during our stay and I had a large present sent to the hotel from Vancouver for him. When a problem occurred Cory went above the call of duty to sort everything out, which was very comforting seeing as we live in the UK.
reviews.title: Our Favourite Inn in the World!

likes.disliked: — one size fits all bikes - I prefer to ride a ladies bike

reviews.text: Our one concern is the restaurant. The service has always been great, the setting stunning, but the food was not as good as our previous visits. Dinner was OK but not the standard we have come to expect. Breakfast is as good though. All in all we cannot fault this hotel. We have stayed in many fantastic hotels throughout the world, and would say we are quite demmanding in expecting value for money whatever the price, the Wickaninnish never lets us down.
reviews.title: Perfect setting & excellent service
Put a damper on a west coast adventure
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four nights at The Wick. The wonderful check in experience was a great start. We were checked in by one person who then carried our bags to our room and showed us around thoroughly - so that we knew from the start that we were provided with umbrellas, rain slickers, blankets for on the deck, CD's, daily tide times and so on and so on! She then parked our car, which we could call for at a moments notice. We were in the main building on the 2nd floor facing the ocean, rocky shore and beach with an eagle's nest in a tree above our room. An outstanding view - similar to that of the restaurant. We loved the Aveda spa supplies and had mineral salts in our double soaker tub overlooking the ocean every evening. I loved the decor - very natural and high quality. No, there were no white table clothes in the dining room, which offended some other reviewers here, there were hand-woven runners, hand-carved woodwork and candle holders made from sea rocks by local artisans. Decor that matched perfectly with the rain forest on the ocean setting and my husband's refusal to wear a tie on vacation. The chef's tasting menu was delicious and all of the serving staff were very good and informative. All service was professional and then they all took the time to say good morning or to engage in conversation and give advice about other restaurants and things to see and do. The free guided walk through the rain forest and on the beach was great, so were the bikes. The spa was exceptional! Foot soaks on the patio for both of us as we chatted with our therapists before our main treatments. I highly recommend the Sacred Sea thallasotherapy. Although children were welcomed and all seemed to be having a good time, this is a perfect romantic couples place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Tofino on the recommendation of some friends who spent their honeymoon there and decided to stay at the Wickaninnish to finish our rockies tour with a bit of luxury. The hotel has a great location and the room was pure luxury. One thing to be aware of is that there are two locations that you can stay; in The Beach or at The Pointe. We were lucky enough to have a room at The Pointe (301), which had fantastic views of the coast and were quite glad we weren't in The Beach as the views did not look as good and it wasn't as private. We ate at the Pointe Restaurant on the first night and although the food was good it did not warrant the $250 bill and the staff were so completely over the top it wasn't very relaxing.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The actually place of Tofino is amazing. We did plenty of whale watching and had great walks along the beaches. The restaurants in the town are just as good as the Pointe in terms of food and exceed in atmosphere and staff. Try Shelter and The Schooner.
reviews.title: Beautifully relaxing and amazing food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the "Wick" for a brief spell during our honeymoon in British Columbia. We spent 3 nights there and the quality of the place is unmistakable. The rooms all overlook the Pacific with what they call a "wooded sea view" which essentially means there are large trees in front of the windows. They do not spoil the view however.
reviews.title: Amazing Place - you have to go there!
over priced
reviews.text: The best thing about the place has to be the Pointe Restaurant. Beautifully set on the cliff with a 270 degree panoramic view of the beach it is simply stunning. The food and service are also second to none. Typical fine dining food with an excellent variety of dishes and an amazing wine list (which isn't cheap by the way). I wouldn't advise eating there every night as it is very expensive and there are loads of other great restaurants in Tofino to try.
Overall a great experience and 3 nights was plenty as there isn't a great deal to do in Tofino once you've done the whale watching.
reviews.title: Great time at the Wickaninnish Inn

likes.liked: — The place where the hotel is and the hotel itself.

reviews.text: After spending a night at another Tofino lodge, we stopped in at the Wick to see what all the fuss was about. We immediately canceled our remaining stay in the other place and moved to the Wickaninnish. The location can't be beat -- 30 seconds to a 1.5 mile hard sand beach. Our room was on the ground floor and had a view of the ocean, the islands, and the surge inlet just north of the hotel. Amazing! With the door open at night, I went to sleep to the sound of the waves crashing on the rocks just outside the balcony. The staff were over-the-top accommodating and friendly. When we checked in, the front desk person took us to 3 different rooms to see which one we would prefer. The food in the restaurant was superb -- fresh, organic, and local. Because I'm a budget-conscious traveler, I don't think I would ever visit the Wick in high season. It's just too expensive. But we got a room at half price and, at that rate, I thought the accommodation and the service was a bargain.
reviews.title: Very, very comfortable

reviews.text: Wanting a cool getaway from the heat and humidity of Nashville in August, my husband, a couple with whom we travel frequently, and I spent 5 days at the Wickaninnish Inn. It was all we'd hoped for and more. Our rooms had giant soaking tubs in the bathroom window, balconies and large bedroom windows looking on the ocean, plus comfortable beds, a gas fireplace, a large shower, and lots of little extras like binoculars, books and rain suits.
reviews.title: Perfect August Trip at the Wick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent at the Pointe Restaurant, lots of salmon, crab and halibut, and we also enjoyed a crab feast on the beach one night. At low tide, the Wick has the best tide pools I've ever seen, filled with hundreds of starfish and anemones. The beach is flat and perfect for long walks. Although we weren't there during the storm watching season, we did have one day of rain and wind and we loved our walk on the beach that day as well as relaxing afterward with lattes and then reading [and napping] in front of the fire.
reviews.title: A very special place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tofino is also a fun little town, with good excursions to watch whales and bears as well as art galleries and food and wine of a much higher quality than we had expected in such a small place.
reviews.title: One of our two favorite hotels in the world.

reviews.text: We had been to Vancouver Island before, but only to the Butchart Gardens and Victoria. The west coast of the Island is magnificent, and the Inn deserves all the stars and rave reviews that it's won.
reviews.title: Wickaninnish Inn for people who hate kids and love cars

likes.disliked: — reliance on cars, poor attitude to children

aka: Wickaninnish Inn And The Pointe Restaurant Hotel Tofino
description: Wickaninnish Inn, a Relais & Chateaux property since 1997, overlooks the Pacific Ocean from a rocky point on Vancouver Island’s rugged west coast, near the eclectic town of Tofino and Pacific Rim National Park. Two contemporary cedar buildings, set against a backdrop of ancient rainforest, boast an extensive local art collection (complemented by the neighbouring wood carving shed), and all rooms and suites offer ocean or beach views, gas fireplace, soaker tub and individual balcony. Uncompromising service, including a Clefs d’Or Concierge team, is a standard. The sole resort on Chesterman Beach, Tofino’s longest at 2.5km/1.5mi, the Inn is home to refined West Coast cuisine at The Pointe Restaurant and naturally-inspired treatments at its intimate Ancient Cedars Spa. Tofino’s McDiarmid family welcomes you to this locally owned, world renowned sanctuary offering Rustic Elegance on Nature’s Edge.
